definitions.definition: a noisy and violent fight involving a group of people, usually in a public place

examples.text: They'd got into a brawl in a bar.
Police officers were injured in a mass brawl outside a nightclub.
They got caught up in a street brawl.
a brawl between different gangs of football supporters.
a brawl over a parking space

wordOrigin: late Middle English: perhaps ultimately imitative and related to bray.
